Text: One of the best docs of the new century.
so. which version is better? theatrical one or the TV one?  Did the theatrical one have additional scenes.. or was it cut ?

I have to agree. This is easily one of the best documentaries I have ever seen. And I work in the film business so I really give a lot of respect to this man and this film.. Its fantastic...

(And yes, even folks in the biz download films. Hurrah for piracy!)

Which version is better? I can't say at this point. But the ALLiANCE DVDrip version I downloaded the other night has very bad framerate, so choppy I had to stop the video despite the intriguing content. I'm sure it's an honest mistake. The documentary is made by BBC, which means a British standard 25FPS video. ALLiANCE tried to conform it to NTSC, which of course didn't work. I hope this one is done properly.
